p: Patients with cirrhosis or HCC had higher anti-HDV prevalence relative to comparator populations from the same geographic region, with pooled ORs of 6.7 and 4.8, respectively ( Fig. 5 and supplementary appendices 24 and 25). Among HBsAg-positive people with sequelae of infection, our PAF calculation suggested that HDV accounted for 18% of cirrhosis (95% CI 10–26) and 20% of HCC (95% CI 8–33) ( supplementary appendices 26 and 27).
